templates.title: Templates
templates.description: In which we get some Angular running in a browser.

binding.title: Binding
binding.description: Where we discover the spooky magic that is Angular data binding (of course it's not magic really, as we shall very soon see).

more-binding.title: More on Binding
more-binding.description: In which we bind expressions to classes and attributes and add conditional logic to our templates.

controllers.title: Controllers
controllers.description: Controllers glue the scope to the template.

scope.title: Scope and Scope Inheritance (View Model)
scope.description: $scope is an object in which you can store your models

watch.title: Watch and the digest cycle
watch.description: Here we delve into the workings of the digest cycle and discover the logic behind Angular data binding.

di.title: Dependency Injection (DI)
di.description: Dependency Injection allows us to require components simply be referring to them. Learn about DI and also split your code into sensible modules.

karma.title: Unit Testing with Karma (Testacular)
karma.description: All good developers write unit tests. We will too.

homework.title: Homework
homework.description: Fun and simple homework. It's like school

repeat-and-filter.title: Repeat and Filter
repeat-and-filter.description: The show-off feature of Angular. This stuff makes clients really happy.

ajax.title: AJAX
ajax.description: Drop JSON into your $scope and it will automatically bind it to the template.

ng-include.title: Templates and the Template Cache
ng-include.description: Talking to the template cache directly can make your app feel more responsive. Learn how.

custom-filters.title: Writing Custom Filters
custom-filters.description: A filter is a function for modifying and presenting data. We learn to write and use our own.

services.title: Writing Services
services.description: Services are singleton objects that act as repositories of useful functions. How to make them, and when to use them.

promises.title: Promises
promises.description: Tidying up asynchronous code using promises.

directives.title: Writing Directives
directives.description: Directives tell the Angular compiler how to transform the DOM. They are the guts of Angular. You will learn all about them.

directive-compilation.title: Directive Compilation
directive-compilation.description: We look at how the Angular compiler traverses the DOM, oreder of compilation, and when to use the compile, link and controller functions.

parse.description: How to make out directives receive an expression.

testing-directives.title: Unit testing directives using Karma
testing-directives.description: Unit testing is for directives too.

isolate-scope.title: Isolate Scopes
isolate-scope.description: One of the most misunderstood features of directives. We learn, in detail, how to control the scope hierarchy.

homework-2.title: Homework 2
homework-2.description: Again, like school, but better paid.

transclusion.title: Directive Transclusion
transclusion.description: Transclusion allows us to pass template content to a directive as an attribute. This is a lot more useful than it sounds. Here we see why.

crud.title: Create, Read, Update, Delete
crud.description: We put it together and talk to a real RESTful API to build a little content driven app

webapi.title: Build a back end with WebAPI
webapi.description: Build a simple API with WebAPI, then integrate from it.

validation.title: Form Validation
validation.description: We validate our inputs the right way

resource.title: Resource
resource.description: Resource is an ORM for REST. Powerful and terse AJAX.

routing.title: Routing
routing.description: Learn about routing, Pushstate, and how to make an Angular site SEO friendly without hashbangs

ui-router.title: UI Router
ui-router.description: The UI Router is an alternative state based router for Angular. Learn all about it.
